info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 7:57PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL UNION COUNTY THROUGH 845 PM MDT... At 757 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Clayton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clayton. This includes Highway 64 between Mile Markers 423 and 429. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM MDT for northeastern New Mexico.
